form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Received; read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

form.official-title: To provide for the elimination or modification of Federal reporting requirements.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Government Reports Elimination Act of 2014.
The table of contents for this Act is as follows:

toc.toc-entry: Title III—Corporation for National and Community Service
Sec. 501. Report on Impact Aid construction justifying discretionary grant awards eliminated.
Sec. 701. Great Lakes management comprehensive report eliminated.
Title VIII—Executive Office of the President
Sec. 801. Report relating to waiver of certain sanctions against North Korea eliminated.
Title XI—Department of Housing and Urban Development
Title XIV—Office of the Director of National Intelligence

subsection.header: Information on administrative expenses on commodity promotion programs
subsection.text: Section 501 of the Federal Agriculture Improvement and Reform Act of 1996 (7 U.S.C. 7401) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking subsection (d); and
by redesignating subsections (e) and (f) as subsections (d) and (e), respectively.

subsection.header: Unfair trade practices report and related meeting
subsection.text: Section 108 of the Act of August 28, 1954 (commonly known as the Agricultural Act of 1954; 7 U.S.C. 1748) is repealed.

subsection.header: Farmland Protection Policy Act annual report
subsection.text: Section 1546 of the Agriculture and Food Act of 1981 (7 U.S.C. 4207) is repealed.

subsection.header: Peanut base acres data collection and publication
subsection.text: Section 1302(d) of the Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 8752(d)) is amended by striking paragraph (3).

subsection.header: Other base acres data collection and publication
subsection.text: Section 1101(d) of the Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 8711(d)) is amended by striking paragraph (3).

subsection.header: Beginning farmer and rancher individual development accounts pilot program report
subsection.text: Section 333B of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act (7 U.S.C. 1983b) is amended by striking subsection (e) and redesignating subsections (f) through (h) as subsections (e) through (g), respectively.

subsection.header: Rural broadband access program report
subsection.text: Section 601 of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 (7 U.S.C. 950bb) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (d)(1)(B), by striking (k) and inserting (j); and
by striking subsection (j) and redesignating subsections (k) and (l) as subsections (j) and (k), respectively.

subsection.header: Report on export credit guarantees to emerging markets
subsection.text: Section 1542(e) of the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 (Public Law 101–624; 7 U.S.C. 5622 note) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking (1) Effect of credits.—; and
by striking paragraph (2).

subsection.header: Commodity Credit Corporation Quarterly Report
subsection.text: Section 13 of the Commodity Credit Corporation Charter Act (15 U.S.C. 714k) is amended by striking the second sentence.

subsection.header: Evaluation of the rural development, business and industry guaranteed loan program financing of locally or regionally produced food products
subsection.text: Section 310B(g)(9)(B) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act (7 U.S.C. 1932(g)(9)(B)) is amended by striking clause (iv) and redesignating clause (v) as clause (iv).

subsection.header: United States Grain Standards Act reports
subsection.text: Section 17B of the United States Grain Standards Act (7 U.S.C. 87f–2) is repealed.

subsection.header: Listing of areas rural in character
subsection.text: Section 6018 of the Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008 (122 Stat. 1933; Public Law 110–246) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking (a) Rural Area.—; and
by striking subsection (b).

subsection.header: Notifications to Congress on release of names and addresses of producers operating under marketing agreements and orders
subsection.text: Section 8d(2) of the Agricultural Adjustment Act (7 U.S.C. 608d(2)) is amended by striking The Secretary shall notify the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate and the Committee on Agriculture of the House of Representatives not later than 10 legislative days before the contemplated release under law, of the names and addresses of producers participating in such marketing agreements and orders, and shall include in such notice a statement of reasons relied upon by the Secretary in making the determination to release such names and addresses..

subsection.header: Plant pest and disease management and disaster prevention action plans reports
subsection.text: Section 420(c) of the Plant Protect Act (7 U.S.C. 7721(c)) is amended by striking paragraph (3).

subsection.header: Quarterly export assistance reports
subsection.text: Section 603 of the Agricultural Trade Act of 1978 (7 U.S.C. 5713) is repealed.

subsection.header: Rural collaborative investment program

paragraph.header: Secretarial report on regional rural investment boards
paragraph.text: Section 385C(b)(7) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act (7 U.S.C. 2009dd–2(b)(7)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by adding and at the end of subparagraph (B);
by striking ; and at the end of subparagraph (C) and inserting a period; and

paragraph.header: Report by regional rural investment board to national rural investment board and the secretary
paragraph.text: Section 385D(a)(7) of such Act (7 U.S.C. 2009dd–3(a)(7)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by adding and at the end of subparagraph (C); and
by striking subparagraph (D) and redesignating subparagraph (E) as subparagraph (D).

subsection.header: Status Report for Food for Progress Program
subsection.text: Subsection (j) of the Food for Progress Act of 1985 (7 U.S.C. 1736o) is amended by striking paragraph (3).

subsection.header: Status Report for Foreign market development
subsection.text: Section 702 of the Agricultural Trade Act of 1978 (7 U.S.C. 5722) is amended by striking subsection (c).

subsection.header: Technical assistance for specialty crops status reports
subsection.text: Section 3205 of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 (7 U.S.C. 5680) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking subsection (d); and
by redesignating subsection (e) as subsection (d).

subsection.header: Southeastern Alaska timber reports
subsection.text: Section 706 of the Alaska National Interest Lands Conservation Act is repealed.

subsection.header: Efforts and progress in becoming designated as sea grant college or institute
subsection.text: Section 207 of the National Sea Grant Program Act (33 U.S.C. 1126) is amended by striking subsection (e).

subsection.header: Enterprise integration standardization and implementation
subsection.text: Section 3(c) of the Enterprise Integration Act of 2001 (15 U.S.C. 278g–5 note) is repealed.

subsection.header: Ensuring equal access to sea grant fellowship program
subsection.text: Section 208(a) of the National Sea Grant Program Act (33 U.S.C. 1127(a)) is amended by striking the fourth sentence.

subsection.header: TIP activities
subsection.text: Section 28(g) of the National Institute of Standards and Technology Act (15 U.S.C. 278n(g)) is repealed.

subsection.header: TIP advisory board annual report
subsection.text: Section 28(k)(5) of the National Institute of Standards and Technology Act (15 U.S.C. 278n(k)(5)) is repealed.

subsection.header: Northwest Atlantic fisheries activities
subsection.text: Section 212 of the Northwest Atlantic Fisheries Convention Act of 1995 (16 U.S.C. 5611) is repealed.

title.header: Corporation for National and Community Service

subsection.header: Reports by Other Federal Agencies to the Corporation
subsection.text: Section 182 of the National and Community Service Act of 1990 (42 U.S.C. 12642) is amended by striking subsection (b).

subsection.header: Service-Learning Impact Study
subsection.text: The National and Community Service Act of 1990 (42 U.S.C. 12565) is amended by repealing part IV of subtitle B of title I.

subsection.header: Amendments to national defense authorization acts

paragraph.header: Display of annual budget requirements for air sovereignty alert mission
paragraph.text: Section 354 of the Duncan Hunter National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2009 (Public Law 110–417; 10 U.S.C. 221 note) is hereby repealed.

paragraph.header: Annual report on reliability of Department of Defense financial statements
paragraph.text: Section 1008 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2002 (Public Law 107–107; 10 U.S.C. 113 note) is amended—

subsection.header: Amendments to title 10

paragraph.header: Annual report on emergency and extraordinary expenses
paragraph.text: Section 127 of title 10, United States Code, is amended by striking subsection (d).

paragraph.header: Report on assistance provided to foreign nations to account for missing U.S. personnel
paragraph.text: Section 408 of title 10, United States Code, is amended by striking subsection (f).

paragraph.header: Inclusion of net floor area in requests to build military family housing
paragraph.text: Section 2826 of title 10, United States Code, is amended—

subsection.header: Amendment to Small Business Act commercialization readiness program
subsection.text: Section 9(y)(5) of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 638(y)(5)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking subparagraph (B);
by striking authorized to— through establish goals and inserting authorized to establish goals; and
by striking ; and at the end and inserting a period.

section.header: Report on Impact Aid construction justifying discretionary grant awards eliminated
section.text: Section 8007(b) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 7707) is amended by striking paragraph (7).

subsection.header: Science and engineering education pilot program
subsection.text: Section 983(d) of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 (42 U.S.C. 16323(d)) is repealed.

subsection.header: Strategic unconventional fuels development program
subsection.text: Section 369(i)(3) of Energy Policy Act of 2005 (42 U.S.C. 15927(i)(3)) is repealed.

subsection.header: Energy efficiency standards for industrial equipment
subsection.text: Section 342(a)(6)(C)(v) of Energy Policy and Conservation Act (42 U.S.C. 6313(a)(6)(C)(v)) is repealed.

section.header: Great Lakes management comprehensive report eliminated
section.text: Section 118(c)(10) of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act (33 U.S.C. 1268(c)(10)) is repealed.

section.header: Report relating to waiver of certain sanctions against North Korea eliminated
section.text: Section 1405 of the Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2008 (22 U.S.C. 2799aa–1 note) is amended by striking subsection (c).

subsection.header: Expenditures of Local Educational Agencies
subsection.text: Section 1904 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 6574) is repealed.

subsection.header: Use of Recovery Act funds by States and localities report
subsection.text: Section 901 of the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 (Public Law 111–5; 123 Stat. 191) is repealed.

subsection.header: Help America Vote Act Funds audit

paragraph.text: Section 902(b) of the Help America Vote Act of 2002 (42 U.S.C. 15542(b)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (4) through (6) as paragraphs (3) through (5).

paragraph.header: Preservation of authority to recoup funds resulting from prior audits
paragraph.text: Section 902(c) of such Act (42 U.S.C. 15542(c)) is amended by inserting after subsection (b) the following: prior to the date of the enactment of the Government Reports Elimination Act of 2014.

subsection.header: State Small Business Credit Initiative audit and report
subsection.text: Section 3011 of the Small Business Jobs Act of 2010 (12 U.S.C. 5710) is amended by striking subsection (b).

subsection.header: Small Business Lending Fund Program audit and report
subsection.text: Section 4107 of the Small Business Jobs Act of 2010 (12 U.S.C. 4741 note) is amended by striking subsection (c).

subsection.header: Housing Assistance Council financial statement audit report
subsection.text: Section 6303(a) of the Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008 (42 U.S.C. 1490e note) is amended by striking paragraph (3).

subsection.header: National Prevention, Health Promotion and Public Health Council
subsection.text: Subsection (i) of section 4001 of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (42 U.S.C. 300u–1) is amended by striking The Secretary and the Comptroller General of the United States shall jointly conduct periodic reviews and inserting The Secretary shall conduct periodic reviews.

subsection.header: Postcard mandate
subsection.text: Section 719(g)(2) of title 31, United States Code is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking the first sentence and inserting the following: The Comptroller General shall make each list available through the public website of the Government Accountability Office.; and
in the second sentence, by inserting of Congress after committee or member.

subsection.header: Annual audit of the Congressional Award Foundation

paragraph.text: Section 107 of the Congressional Award Act (2 U.S.C. 807) is amended to read as follows:

subsection.header: Contracts With Private Auditor
subsection.text: The Board shall enter into a contract with an accredited private auditor to conduct an annual audit of the financial records of the Board and of any corporation established under section 106(i), and shall ensure that the auditor has access for the purpose of the audit to any books, documents, papers, and records of the Board or such corporation (or any agent of the Board or such corporation) which the auditor reasonably determines to be pertinent to the Congressional Award Program.

subsection.header: Annual Report to Congress on Audit Results
subsection.text: Not later than May 15 of each calendar year, the Board shall submit to appropriate officers, committees, and subcommittees of Congress a report on the results of the most recent audit conducted pursuant to this section, and shall include in the report information on any such additional areas as the auditor who conducted the audit determines deserve or require evaluation.

paragraph.header: Conforming amendment relating to compliance with fiscal control and fund accounting procedures
paragraph.text: Section 104(c)(2)(A) of such Act (2 U.S.C. 804(c)(2)(A)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the first sentence, by striking The Comptroller General of the United States and inserting The accredited private auditor conducting the annual audit of the financial records of the Board pursuant to section 107(a); and
in the second sentence, by striking the Comptroller General and inserting the auditor.

subsection.header: Annual GAO review of proposed HHS recovery threshold
subsection.text: The third sentence of section 1862(b)(9)(B)(i) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395y(b)(9)(B)(i)) is amended by striking for a year and inserting for 2014.

subsection.header: Prohibition on importation of products made with dog or cat fur
subsection.text: Section 308 of the Tariff Act of 1930 (19 U.S.C. 1308) is amended by striking subsection (e).

subsection.header: Port of Entry Infrastructure Assessment Study and National Land Border Security Plan
subsection.text: The Border Infrastructure and Technology Modernization Act of 2007 (title VI of division E of Public Law 110–161; 6 U.S.C. 1401 et seq.) is amended by striking sections 603 and 604.

subsection.header: Fees for certain customs services

paragraph.text: Section 13031 of the Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1985 (Public Law 99–272; 19 U.S.C. 58c) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a)(9), by striking subparagraph (C) and redesignating subparagraph (D) as subparagraph (C); and

clause.text: by redesignating paragraphs (5) and (6) as paragraphs (4) and (5), respectively.

paragraph.text: Subsection (f) of such section is further amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1)(B), by striking paragraph (5) and inserting paragraph (4); and
in paragraph (3)(A), by striking paragraph (5) and inserting paragraph (4).

subsection.header: Modernization of National Distress and Response System
subsection.text: Section 346 of the (Public Law 107–295) Maritime Transportation Security Act of 2002 (14 U.S.C. 88 note), and the item relating to such section in the table of contents in section 1(b) of such Act, are repealed.

title.header: Department of Housing and Urban Development

subsection.header: Information technology spending plan for Transformation Initiative
subsection.text: The first sentence of the second paragraph under the heading Department of Housing and Urban Development—Management and Administration—Transformation Initiative in title II of division A of Public Law 111–117 (123 Stat. 3093), as amended by section 2259 of title XII of division B of Public Law 112–10 (125 Stat. 197), is amended by striking : Provided, That and all that follows through Government Accountability Office.

subsection.header: Sole source contracts report
subsection.text: Section 218 of the Transportation, Housing and Urban Development, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2012 (division C of Public Law 112–55; 125 Stat. 699) is repealed.

section.text: Section 342(e) of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 (42 U.S.C. 15902(e)) is amended by striking subsection (e).

subsection.header: Older Americans Act
subsection.text: Section 515 of the Older Americans Act (42 U.S.C. 3056m) is repealed.

subsection.header: Andean Trade Preference Act
subsection.text: Section 207 of the Andean Trade Preference Act (19 U.S.C. 3205) is repealed.

title.header: Office of the Director of National Intelligence

subsection.header: Treaty on Conventional Armed Forces in Europe
subsection.text: Section 2(5)(E) of the Senate resolution advising and consenting to ratification of the Document Agreed Among the States Parties to the Treaty on Conventional Armed Forces in Europe (CFE) of November 19, 1990, adopted at Vienna May 31, 1996 (Treaty Doc. 105–5) (commonly referred to as the CFE Flank Document), 105th Congress, agreed to May 14, 1997, is repealed.

subsection.header: Reports on commerce with, and assistance to, Cuba from other foreign countries

paragraph.text: Section 108 of the Cuban Liberty and Democratic Solidarity (LIBERTAD) Act of 1996 (22 U.S.C. 6038) is repealed.
The table of contents in section 1(b) of such Act is amended by striking the item relating to section 108.

subsection.header: Identification of countries of concern with respect to the diversion of certain goods, services, and technologies to or through Iran

paragraph.text: Section 302 of the Comprehensive Iran Sanctions, Accountability, and Divestment Act of 2010 (22 U.S.C. 8542) is repealed.
Section 303(b) of such Act (22 U.S.C. 8543(b)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by striking a report— and inserting a report notifying those committees of the designation of the country.; and

paragraph.text: The table of contents in section 1(b) of such Act is amended by striking the item relating to section 302.

subsection.header: Report on progress toward regional non-Proliferation in South Asia
subsection.text: Section 620F of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 (22 U.S.C. 2376) is amended by striking subsection (c).

subsection.header: Report on Tibet negotiations
subsection.text: Section 613 of the Foreign Relations Authorization Act, Fiscal Year 2003 (22 U.S.C. 6901 note) is amended to read as follows:

subsection.header: In general
subsection.text: The President and the Secretary should encourage the Government of the People’s Republic of China to enter into a dialogue with the Dalai Lama or his representatives leading to a negotiated agreement on Tibet.

subsection.header: Compliance
subsection.text: After such an agreement is reached, the President and the Secretary should work to ensure compliance with the agreement.

subsection.header: Reports of Air Traffic Services Committee
subsection.text: Section 106(p)(7) of title 49, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking subparagraph (H); and
by redesignating subparagraph (I) as subparagraph (H).

subsection.header: Annual summaries of airport financial reports
subsection.text: Section 47107(k) of title 49, United States Code, is repealed.

subsection.header: Annual report on pipeline safety information grants to communities
subsection.text: Section 60130 of title 49, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking subsection (c); and
by redesignating subsection (d) as subsection (c).

subsection.header: Annual report on pilot program for innovative financing of air traffic control equipment
subsection.text: Section 182 of the Vision 100—Century of Aviation Reauthorization Act (117 Stat. 2515; 49 U.S.C. 44502 note) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking subsection (e); and
by redesignating subsection (f) as subsection (e).

subsection.header: Reports on justifications for air defense identification zones
subsection.text: Section 602 of the Vision 100—Century of Aviation Reauthorization Act (117 Stat. 2563), and the item relating to that section in the table of contents contained in section 1(b) of that Act, are repealed.

subsection.header: Annual report on standards for aircraft and aircraft engines To reduce noise levels
subsection.text: Section 726 of the Wendell H. Ford Aviation Investment and Reform Act for the 21st Century (114 Stat. 167; 49 U.S.C. 47508 note) is amended by striking subsection (c).

section.text: Section 1138(a) of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking at least annually, but may be conducted.

subsection.header: Annual report on the north american development bank
subsection.text: Section 2 of Public Law 108–215 is repealed.

subsection.header: Report on voting on international financial institutions loan proposals
subsection.text: Section 701 of the International Financial Institutions Act (22 U.S.C. 262d) is amended by striking subsection (c) and redesignating subsection (d) through subsection (g) (as added by section 501(g) of Public Law 96–259) as subsections (c) through (f), respectively.

subsection.header: Report on new IMF arrangements regarding rates and maturities
subsection.text: Section 605 of the Foreign Operations, Export Financing, and Related Programs Appropriations Act, 1999 (112 Stat. 2681–223), as enacted into law by section 101(d) of division A of the Omnibus Consolidated and Emergency Supplemental Appropriations Act, 1999 (Public Law 105–277), is amended by striking subsection (d).

subsection.header: Report on significant modifications
subsection.text: The Government Securities Act Amendments of 1993 (Public Law 103–202) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking section 203; and
in the table of contents for such Act, by striking the item relating to section 203.

subsection.header: Annual report on activities and proposals involving contracting for performance by contractor personnel of work previously performed by Department employees
subsection.text: Section 8110 of such title is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking subsection (c); and
by redesignating subsections (d), (e), and (f) as subsections (c), (d), and (e), respectively.

subsection.header: Annual report on procurement of health-Care items
subsection.text: Section 8125 of such title is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking subsection (d); and
by redesignating subsection (e) as subsection (d).

subsection.header: Annual report on staffing for nurses and nurse anaesthetists at Department facilities
subsection.text: Section 7451(e) of such title is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking paragraph (5); and
by redesignating paragraph (6) as paragraph (5).

subsection.header: Annual report on use of authorities To enhance retention of experienced nurses

paragraph.text: Subchapter II of chapter 73 of such title is amended by striking section 7324.
The table of sections at the beginning of such chapter is amended by striking the item relating to section 7324.

attestation-group.attestation-date: Passed the House of Representatives April 28, 2014.
